gov.va.med.srcalc.util

Class ValidationUtils2

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.va.med.srcalc.util.ValidationUtils2

  • public final class ValidationUtils2
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class offering more convenient methods in the spirit of Spring's ValidationUtils.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ValidationUtils2()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean rejectIfDoesntMatch(org.springframework.validation.Errors e, java.lang.String field, java.util.regex.Pattern regex, java.lang.Object[] errorArgs)
      Rejects the identified CharSequence field if it does not match the given regular expression.
      static boolean rejectIfEmpty(org.springframework.validation.Errors errors, java.lang.String field)
      Like ValidationUtils.rejectIfEmpty(Errors, String, String), but returns true if the field was rejected.

      Rejects the identified CharSequence field if it is longer than the given maximum length.

      Validates a required String, ensuring that it is non-empty and within the given length.

      • ValidationUtils2

        public ValidationUtils2()

    • Method Detail

      • rejectIfEmpty

        public static boolean rejectIfEmpty(org.springframework.validation.Errors errors,
                    java.lang.String field)
        Like ValidationUtils.rejectIfEmpty(Errors, String, String), but returns true if the field was rejected. Rejects with the error code ValidationCodes.NO_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        errors - the Errors instance to register errors on
        field - identifies the field. The identified field must be a CharSequence.
        Returns:
        true if the field was rejected, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the identified field is not a CharSequence

      • rejectIfTooLong

        public static boolean rejectIfTooLong(org.springframework.validation.Errors e,
                      java.lang.String field,
                      int maxLength)
        Rejects the identified CharSequence field if it is longer than the given maximum length. If the field is rejected, it will be with the error code ValidationCodes.TOO_LONG.
        Parameters:
        e - the Errors instance to register errors on
        field - identifies the field. The identified field must be a CharSequence.
        maxLength - the maxmimum valid length of the field
        Returns:
        true if the field was rejected, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the identified field is not a CharSequence

      • rejectIfDoesntMatch

        public static boolean rejectIfDoesntMatch(org.springframework.validation.Errors e,
                          java.lang.String field,
                          java.util.regex.Pattern regex,
                          java.lang.Object[] errorArgs)
        Rejects the identified CharSequence field if it does not match the given regular expression. If the field is rejected, it will be with the error code ValidationCodes.INVALID_CONTENTS.
        Parameters:
        e - the Errors instance to register errors on
        field - identifies the field. The identified field must be a CharSequence.
        regex - the compiled regular expression
        errorArgs - the errorArgs to pass to rejectValue
        Returns:
        true if the field was rejected, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the identified field is not a CharSequence

      • validateRequiredString

        public static boolean validateRequiredString(java.lang.String value,
                             int rowNumber,
                             java.lang.String fieldName,
                             int maxLength,
                             java.util.Collection<TabularUploadError> errors)

        Validates a required String, ensuring that it is non-empty and within the given length.

        Unlike the above, this method operates on TabularUploadErrors, not Spring's Errors.

        Parameters:
        value - the string to validate
        rowNumber - the associated row's number
        fieldName - the field name for recording validation errors
        maxLength - the maximum valid length of the field
        errors - to record validation errors
        Returns:
        true if the string was valid, false otherwise
